trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> types to UI Automation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ScrollViewerAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ScrollViewerAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ScrollViewerAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType.Pane"></xref> enumeration value.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ScrollViewerAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName"></xref>.
A string that contains "ScrollViewer".

Gets the control pattern for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ScrollViewerAutomationPeer"></xref>.
A value in the enumeration.
If patternInterface is , this method returns a `this` pointer; otherwise, this method returns `null`.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ScrollViewerAutomationPeer"></xref> is understood by the end user as interactive or as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)].
This method is called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement"></xref>.
If the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.TemplatedParent"></xref> is `null`, this method returns `true`; otherwise, `false`.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Value indicating whether control is can be scrolled in the horizontal direction.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The horizontal scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Returns `S_OK` if successful, or an error value otherwise.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The horizontal increment specific to the control.
The vertical increment specific to the control.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Percent scrolled horizontally.
Percent scrolled vertically.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if the control can scroll vertically; otherwise `false`.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Returns `S_OK` if successful, or an error value otherwise.
